headline: Economic fears of investors are here — and fed by Trump’s reaction
summary: For months, the U.S. economy appeared to be weathering the disruptive effects of President Donald Trump’s trade and immigration policies. But over the course of 72 hours, that sunny outlook darkened, as the latest government data this week showed the president’s revolutionary remaking of the world’s largest economy had hit a snag.Subscribe to The Post Most newsletter for the most important and interesting stories from The Washington Post. headline: From Laos to Brazil, Trump's tariffs leave a lot of losers. But even the winners will pay a price
summary: The closest thing to winners may be the countries that caved to Trump's demands — and avoided even more pain.  Barely six months after he returned to the White House, Trump has demolished the old global economic order.

raw.headline: From Laos to Brazil, Trump's tariffs leave a lot of losers. But even the winners will pay a price

headline: This Dividend King Just Issued a Tariff Warning. Is Its Reliable Yield Enough to Soften the Blow?
summary: Facing $1 billion in added tariff costs, Procter & Gamble plans to raise prices and lean on cost cuts, but its 70-year dividend growth record and strong cash flows continue to anchor the stock’s appeal for income-focused investors.
